00001 #########################################################################
00002 #
00003 #  Implements the Vector class
00004 #
00005 package Parser::List::Vector;
00006 use strict;
00007 our @ISA = qw(Parser::List);
00008 
00009 #
00010 #  The basic List class does nearly everything.
00011 #
00012 
00013 #
00014 #  Check that the coordinates are numbers (avoid <i+j+k>)
00015 #
00016 sub _check {
00017   my $self = shift; return if $self->context->flag("allowBadOperands");
00018   foreach my $x (@{$self->{coords}}) {
00019     unless ($x->isNumber) {
00020       my $type = $x->type;
00021       $type = (($type =~ m/^[aeiou]/i)? "an ": "a ") . $type;
00022       $self->{equation}->Error(["Coordinates of Vectors must be Numbers, not %s",$type]);
00023     }
00024   }
00025 }
00026 
00027 my $ijk_string = ['i','j','k','0'];
00028 my $ijk_TeX = ['\boldsymbol{i}','\boldsymbol{j}','\boldsymbol{k}','\boldsymbol(0)'];
00029 
00030 sub ijk {
00031   my $self = shift;
00032   my $method = shift || 'TeX'; my $ijk = shift || $ijk_TeX;
00033   my @coords = @{$self->{coords}};
00034   $self->Error("Method 'ijk' can only be used on vectors in three-space")
00035     unless (scalar(@coords) <= 3);
00036   my $prec = $self->{equation}{context}->operators->get('*')->{precedence};
00037   my $string = ''; my $n; my $term;
00038   foreach $n (0..scalar(@coords)-1) {
00039     $term = $coords[$n]->$method($prec);
00040     if ($term ne '0') {
00041       $term = '' if $term eq '1'; $term = '-' if $term eq '-1';
00042       $term = '+' . $term unless $string eq '' or $term =~ m/^-/;
00043       $string .= $term . $ijk->[$n];
00044     }
00045   }
00046   $string = $ijk->[3] if $string eq '';
00047   return $string;
00048 }
00049 
00050 sub TeX {
00051   my $self = shift;
00052   if ($self->{ijk} || $self->{equation}{ijk} || $self->{equation}{context}->flag("ijk")) 
00053     {return $self->ijk}
00054   return $self->SUPER::TeX;
00055 }
00056 
00057 sub string {
00058   my $self = shift;
00059   if ($self->{ijk} || $self->{equation}{ijk} || $self->{equation}{context}->flag("ijk")) 
00060     {return $self->ijk('string',$ijk_string)}
00061   return $self->SUPER::string;
00062 }
